info.title: API GeographicLocation
info.description:
## TMF API Reference : TMF675 - Geographic Location
### Release : 19.5
A GeographicLocation is a pure-virtual super-class to the GeoJSON-aligned sub-types of Point (addresses and locations), MultiPoint, LineString (streets, highways and boundaries), MultiLineString and Polygon (countries, provinces, tracts of land). Use the @type attribute to specify which of these is being specified by the geometry attribute.

get.description: This operation list or find GeographicLocation entities

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated properties to be provided in response

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Requested index for start of resources to be provided in response

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Requested number of resources to be provided in response

X-Result-Count.description: Actual number of items returned in the response body

X-Total-Count.description: Total number of items matching criteria

post.description: This operation creates a GeographicLocation entity.

get.description: This operation retrieves a GeographicLocation entity. Attribute selection is enabled for all first level attributes.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated properties to provide in response

patch.description: This operation updates partially a GeographicLocation entity.

delete.description: This operation deletes a GeographicLocation entity.

parameters.description: Data containing the callback endpoint to deliver the information

delete.description: Resets the communication endpoint address the service instance must use to deliver information about its health state, execution state, failures and metrics.

parameters.description: The id of the registered listener

GeographicLocation.description: A GeographicLocation is a pure-virtual super-class to the GeoJSON-aligned geometries of Point (addresses and locations), MultiPoint, LineString (streets, highways and boundaries), MultiLineString and Polygon (countries, provinces, tracts of land). Use the @type attribute to specify which of these is being specified by the geometry attribute.

id.description: Unique identifier of the geographic location

href.description: An URI used to access to the geographic location resource

@type.description: The name of the GeoJSON structure used in the geometry attribute

bbox.description: A bounding box array that contains the geometry. The axes order follows the axes order of the geometry

GeographicLocation_Create.description:
A GeographicLocation is a pure-virtual super-class to the GeoJSON-aligned geometries of Point (addresses and locations), MultiPoint, LineString (streets, highways and boundaries), MultiLineString and Polygon (countries, provinces, tracts of land). Use the @type attribute to specify which of these is being specified by the geometry attribute.
Skipped properties: id,href

name.description: A user-friendly name for the place, such as [Paris Store], [London Store], [Main Home]

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: The name of the GeoJSON structure used in the geometry attribute

GeoJsonLineString.description: Container for GeoJson LineString: A collection of Points forming a connected line

GeoJsonMultiLineString.description: A container for GeoJSON MultiLineString: A collection of distinct LineStrings

GeoJsonMultiPoint.description: Container for GeoJSON MultiPoint: A collection of Points

GeoJsonPoint.description: Container for a GeoJSON Point: A single position

GeoJsonPolygon.description: Container for GeoJSON Polygon: An array of linear rings

LineString.description: GeoJSON: A collection of Points forming a connected line

Error.description: Used when an API throws an Error, typically with a HTTP error response-code (3xx, 4xx, 5xx)
